FacilityName: Dovex Fruit Company- OS2 2809 Euclid Ave.

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: Washington State Safety and Health Agency

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM                                                                                                                               DOVEX
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

A. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response
   
   Dovex Fruit Company¿s accidental release prevention policy involves a unified
   approach that integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices. It is the
   policy of Dovex to adhere to all applicable federal and state safety and environmental
   regulations.

   Dovex¿s emergency response policy involves the preparation of response plans and
   training of employees in evacuation and the handling of minor ammonia releases.
   
   At Dovex anhydrous ammonia is used on-site. Ammonia is listed on the Extremely
   Hazardous Substance (EHS) list.

B. Regulated Substance Handled at this Facility
   
   Dovex is a fruit processing and cold storage facility, located at 2809 Euclid Ave.,
   Wenatchee Washington. The facility is located in Chelan County. The main office is     located at 2833 Euclid Avenue Wenatchee Washington.
   
   The regulated substance used at Dovex is anhydrous ammonia (CAS# 7664-41-7).  The
   use of anhydrous ammonia is as a refrigerant.

There are 13,167 pounds of anhydrous ammonia in the refrigeration system. In addition, smaller (i.e., Less than 10,000 pounds) separate ammonia refrigeration systems exist at the facility.

   Dovex has established policies, procedures and training to reduce the risk of an
   Accidental hazardous substance release for the safety of its employees and the 
   surrounding areas.
 
1. Industry standards and quality controls were followed in the design of this
    equipment and its manufacture.
2. The facility insures only qualified personnel operate the system.
3. The facility requires that all PSM elements as well as company maintenance
    policies are followed.
4. Only trained and authorized personnel have access to the system.

 
 





C. General Accidental Release P

revention Program

   Dovex¿s accidental release prevention program is based on the following key elements:
	1. Preventive maintenance program
	2. Written Safety procedures and safety equipment
	3. Use of accurate and effective written operating procedures

   Dovex also complies with:
	1. OSHA¿s and Washington State¿s process safety management PSM rule.
	2. Applicable Washington State safety regulations (WAC¿s 296-24 and 296-62)
	3. Applicable local fire codes.

   The ammonia refrigeration system was installed to applicable codes and good practices
   at the time of installation. Piping is elevated to prevent accidental damage to the system
   from moving vehicles. Engine room doors are tight fitting and open outwards. Other
   safety devices Dovex utilizes include:
	1. Computerized controls
	2. High discharge pressure shut-down
	3. Low suction pressure shut-down
	4. Head water high discharge temperature shut-down
	5. Oil pressure failure shut-down
	6. Oil Filter plugged shut-down on the screw compressor
	7. Check valves
	8. 250 psi relief valves on the high pressure side, vented to atmosphere with 180
	    degree pipedown
	
	9. 150 psi relief valves on the low pressure side, vented to atmosphere with 180
	    Degree pipe-down
	10. Personal protective equipment (PPE) ¿ Air-purifying respirator, gloves and
	      Goggles


   Operating Procedures have been prepared by Dovex for employees
   performing operational functions.  The operating procedures are kept in the
   Refrigeration Supervisor¿s office. The procedures include:
	1. Pre-start procedures
	2. Routine operations
	3. Maintenance
	4. Response to minor releases
	5. Emergency action plan


D. Five-Year Accident History

   Dovex has not had any accidents involving ammonia in the last five years.

E. Emergency Response Program

   In addition to the operating procedures, Dovex has established Emergency Response
   Guidelines for releases involving ammonia. These procedures are part of the ongoing
   training.

Dovex has coordinated with the Chelan/Douglas County Local Emergency Planning Committed (LEPC) in the event of an accidental release of  anhydrous ammonia. The LEPC would lead and direct the emergency response efforts.

F. Planned Safety Improvements
    None at this time.
